sndlib.core.validation
Class SolutionValidators

java.lang.Object
  sndlib.core.validation.SolutionValidators
All Implemented Interfaces:
SolutionValidator
public class SolutionValidators
extends java.lang.Object
implements SolutionValidator

This class provides the common method to check a given SolvedProblem for feasibility.

It aggregates all solution validators which are currently implemented.

Author:
Roman Klaehne
See Also:
SolvedProblem, Solution

Field Detail

LINK_CAPACITIES

public static final SolutionValidator LINK_CAPACITIES
This validator checks whether the installed link capacity modules are admissible in a given solution.

The admissibility of the installed capacity modules thereby depends on the link capacity model.

For a link which possesses a pre-installed capacity module this validator also checks whether there is a corresponding ModuleConfiguration in that link's configuration.

See Also:
LinkCapacityModel

LINK_FLOW

public static final SolutionValidator LINK_FLOW
This validator checks whether for each operating state the link flows in a given solution do not exceed the installed link capacities, with respect to the link and survivability model.

See Also:
LinkModel, LinkFlow

DEMAND_FLOW

public static final SolutionValidator DEMAND_FLOW
This validator checks whether for each operating state the demand routings in a given solution satisfy the demand value (the flow path values sum-up to at least the demand value).

See Also:
DemandModel, DemandFlow

ADMISSIBLE_ROUTING_PATH

public static final SolutionValidator ADMISSIBLE_ROUTING_PATH
This validator checks whether for each operating state the routing paths are valid in terms of existence, admissibility and hop-limit restriction.

In more detail:

It is checked whether the demand routing paths are valid with respect to the link and demand model.
If the hop-limit model is set to INDIVIDUAL_HOP_LIMITS then the routing paths must not violate the hop-limit restrictions.
If the admissible path model is set to EXPLICIT_LIST then the routing paths used to route a demand must be contained in that demand's admissible path list.

See Also:
HopLimitModel, AdmissiblePathModel, LinkModel, DemandModel

ADMISSIBLE_ROUTING

public static final SolutionValidator ADMISSIBLE_ROUTING
This validator checks whether for each operating state the demand routings of a given solution are admissible with respect to the routing model.

If the routing model is INTEGER then all flow path values must be integral.
If the routing model is SINGLE_PATH then there must be exactly one flow path per demand routing.
If the routing model is CONTINOUS then there can be an abritrary number of flow paths with non-negative flow value per demand routing.

See Also:
RoutingModel

SURVIVABILITY

public static final SolutionValidator SURVIVABILITY
This validator checks whether the demand routings in case of a failure (when the network is at failure state) are feasible with respect to the used survivability mechanism.

If no survivability mechanism is used, this validator has nothing to check. Otherwise for each single link failure and each demand there must be a routing not containing the corresponding failure link.

In case the 1+1 dedicated path protection mechansim (SurvivabilityModel.ONE_PLUS_ONE_PROTECTION) is used it is also checked whether there is only one protection (and one working) path per demand.

If the shared path protection mechanism (SurvivabilityModel.SHARED_PATH_PROTECTION) is used it is also checked whether path flows not affected by a single link failure (not containing the failure link) are also contained in the corresponding failure routing.

See Also:
SurvivabilityModel, OperatingState

ALL

public static final SolutionValidator ALL
This validator is the singleton instance of this class and aggregates all validators currently implemented.

Method Detail

validateAll

public static com.atesio.utils.message.Messages validateAll(SolvedProblem solvedProblem)
Performs the validation of the given solved problem against the feasibility conditions imposed by all the validators currently implemented.

Parameters:
solvedProblem - the solved problem to validate
Returns:
the messages indicating the feasiblity errors

                                                            java.util.Set<SolutionValidator> validators)

Returns:
the messages indicating the feasiblity errors

validate

public void validate(SolvedProblem solvedProblem,
                     com.atesio.utils.message.Messages errors)
Performs the validation of the given solved problem against the feasibility conditions imposed by all the validators currently implemented.
This method first calls ProblemValidators.validateAll(Problem) and returns immediately if problem errors are found.

Specified by:
validate in interface SolutionValidator
Parameters:
solvedProblem - the solved problem to validate
errors - the message container into those the errors are put
